cards.flavor: Isthay iecepay ofay avorflay exttay oesn'tday eallyray aysay anythingay.
cards.name: Atinlay Igpay
cards.text:
Oubleday ikestray
Eneverwhay Atinlay Igpay's ontrollercay eaksspay ay onnay-Igpay-Atinlay ordway, acrificesay Atinlay Igpay.

cards.name: AWOL
cards.text: Remove target attacking creature from the game. Then remove it from the removed-from-game zone and put it into the absolutely-removed-from-the-freaking-game-forever zone.

cards.flavor: "Step 1: I believe in a power and toughness greater than myself . . . ."
cards.name: Bosom Buddy
cards.text: Whenever you play a spell, you may gain ½ life for each word in that spell's name.

cards.name: Cardpecker
cards.text:
Flying
Gotcha Whenever an opponent touches the table with his or her hand, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Cardpecker from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: And you thought Yawgmoth drove a hard bargain.
cards.name: Cheap Ass
cards.text: Spells you play cost {½} less to play.

cards.artist: Jim “Stop the Da Vinci Beatdown” Pavelec
cards.name: Circle of Protection: Art
cards.text:
As Circle of Protection: Art comes into play, choose an artist.
{1}{W}: The next time a source of your choice by the chosen artist would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
{1}{W}: Return Circle of Protection: Art to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "Here—have a Mudhole."
cards.name: Collector Protector
cards.text: {W}, Give an opponent a nonland card you own from outside the game: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you or Collector Protector this turn.

cards.flavor:
"My Pete Venters theme deck is nearly complete. Then I shall be unstoppable Bwahahahaaa"
—Pete Venters
cards.name: Drawn Together
cards.text:
As Drawn Together comes into play, choose an artist.
Creatures by the chosen artist get +2/+2.

cards.flavor: The ogre appealed the match loss and got it downgraded to a warning.
cards.name: Emcee
cards.text: Whenever another creature comes into play, you may stand up and say in a deep, booming voice "Presenting . . . " and that creature's name. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

cards.artist: Pete “Yes the Urza's Legacy One” Venters
cards.flavor: Synonyms for "erase" we haven't used: ablate, abrade, chafe, fray, frazzle, scuff, and scrub.
cards.name: Erase (Not the Urza's Legacy One)
cards.text:
If you control two or more white permanents that share an artist, you may play Erase (Not the Urza's Legacy One) without paying its mana cost.
Remove target enchantment from the game.

cards.flavor:
Dear Mr. and Mrs. Cranford,
After careful analysis of Jeremy's vocational testing, I feel that he is best suited for a career in either torture or art direction.
cards.name: Fascist Art Director
cards.text: {W}{W}: Fascist Art Director gains protection from the artist of your choice until end of turn..

cards.flavor: The Yotian soldiers hoped that one day R&D would make an artifact creature whose name starts with Z. And in their dreams, it's a 4/1.
cards.name: First Come, First Served
cards.text: The attacking or blocking creature with the lowest collector number has first strike. If two or more creatures are tied, they all have first strike.

cards.flavor: Don't cross him or you'll end up sleeping with the merfolk.
cards.name: Frankie Peanuts
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may ask target player a yes-or-no question. If you do, that player answers the question truthfully and abides by that answer if able until end of turn.

cards.name: Head to Head
cards.text: You and target opponent play Seven Questions about the top card of that player's library. (That player looks at the card, then you ask up to six yes-or-no questions about the card that he or she answers truthfully. You guess the card's name—that's question seven—and the player reveals the card.) If you win, prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn by a source of your choice.

cards.flavor:
"I said ‘Put him in a core set, not a corset'"
—Richard Garfield, Ph.D.
cards.name: Ladies' Knight
cards.text:
Flying
Spells that players wearing at least one item of women's clothing play cost {1} less to play. (Women's clothing is designed to be worn exclusively by women.)

cards.flavor: In the future, she may be a distinguished leader, a great scholar, or a decorated hero. These days all she does is pee the bed.
cards.name: Little Girl
Look at Me, I'm R&D
cards.text:
As Look at Me, I'm R&D comes into play, choose a number and a second number one higher or one lower than that number.
All instances of the first chosen number on permanents, spells, and cards in any zone are the second chosen number.

cards.flavor: You need to be this tall to play this card.
cards.name: Man of Measure
cards.text:
As long as you're shorter than an opponent, Man of Measure has first strike and gets +0/+1.
As long as you're taller than an opponent, Man of Measure gets +1/+0.

cards.flavor: Who consistently managed to win.
cards.name: Save Life
cards.text:
Choose one Target player gains 2½ life; or prevent the next 2½ damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent says "Save" or "Life," you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Save Life from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: They're the chair-men of the bored.
cards.name: Standing Army
cards.text: As long as you're standing, Standing Army has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

cards.flavor: Mongo's fleas no longer bothered him. But the family of goblins that had moved in behind his left ear was starting to get really irritating.
cards.name: Staying Power
cards.text: As long as Staying Power is in play, "until end of turn" and "this turn" effects don't end.

cards.flavor:
"Suck on it, Stangg"
—Sol'kanar the Swamp King
cards.name: Wordmail
cards.text: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each word in its name.

cards.flavor: {1}: This card's flavor text becomes the flavor text of your choice. (This ability doesn't work because it's flavor text, not rules text (but neither does this reminder text, so you figure it out).)
cards.text: {1}: This card's name becomes the name of your choice. Play this ability anywhere, anytime.

cards.name: Ambiguity
cards.text: Whenever a player plays a spell that counters a spell that has been played or a player plays a spell that comes into play with counters, that player may counter the next spell played or put an additional counter on a permanent that has already been played, but not countered.

cards.flavor:
PRICELESS PIC PILFERED
Painting Found Abandoned in Graveyard
Merfolk Decry Wizards' Treatment
cards.name: Artful Looter
cards.text:
{T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
Whenever a permanent comes into play that shares an artist with another permanent you control, untap Artful Looter.

cards.name: Avatar of Me
cards.text:
Avatar of Me costs {1} more to play for each ten years you've been alive.
Avatar of Me's power is equal to your height in feet and its toughness is equal to your American shoe size. Round to the nearest ½.
Avatar of Me's color is the color of your eyes.

cards.artist: Ron “Don't You Dare Change Me” Spears
cards.flavor: He gives credit where credit isn't due.
cards.name: Brushstroke Paintermage
cards.text: {T}: Target permanent's artist becomes the artist of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Like thousands of others, the beebles quit Magic for several years following the release of the Mercadian Masques set.
cards.name: Bursting Beebles
cards.text: Bursting Beebles is unblockable as long as defending player controls two or more nonland permanents that share an artist.

cards.flavor: Save a kill spell to deal with this guy.
cards.name: Carnivorous Death-Parrot
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Carnivorous Death-Parrot unless you say its flavor text.

cards.name: Cheatyface
cards.text:
You may sneak Cheatyface into play at any time without paying for it, but if an opponent catches you right away, that player may remove Cheatyface from the game.
Flying

cards.flavor: Players that don't read flavor text aren't too bright, sorta smell, and dress funny. But let's just keep this between us, okay? They can get kind of violent.
cards.name: Double Header
cards.text:
Flying
When Double Header comes into play, you may return target permanent with a two-word name to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "Don't worry about it. It happens to every mage sooner or later."
cards.name: Flaccify
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}{½}.

cards.artist: Alan “Don't Feel Like You Have to Pick Me” Pollack
cards.flavor: Who knew an 8˝ by 10˝ could feel like a 2˝ by 4˝?
cards.name: Framed!
cards.text: Tap or untap all permanents by the artist of your choice.

cards.name: Greater Morphling
cards.text:
{2}: Greater Morphling gains your choice of banding, bushido 1, double strike, fear, flying, first strike, haste, landwalk of your choice, protection from a color of your choice, provoke, rampage 1, shadow, or trample until end of turn.
{2}: Greater Morphling becomes the colors of your choice until end of turn.
{2}: Greater Morphling's type becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
{2}: Greater Morphling's expansion symbol becomes the symbol of your choice until end of turn.
{2}: Greater Morphling's artist becomes the artist of your choice until end of turn.
{2}: Greater Morphling gets +2/-2 or -2/+2 until end of turn.
{2}: Untap Greater Morphling.

cards.flavor: "Just wait till I get my Krark-Clan Ironworks, Genesis Chamber, and Grinding Station. Oh yeah, and a second Myr Retriever."
cards.name: Johnny, Combo Player
cards.text: {4}: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Your sentence can't be longer than this one.
cards.name: Loose Lips
cards.text:
As Loose Lips comes into play, choose a sentence with eight or fewer words.
Enchanted creature has flying.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you draw two cards unless that player says the chosen sentence.

cards.name: Magical Hacker
cards.text: {U}: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of + with -, and vice versa, until end of turn.

cards.flavor: mise 'miz v alter. of might as well (1997) 1: to win when you don't deserve to 2: to top-deck the "tings" you need 3: to be rewarded by an opponent's bad luck 4: to coin a phrase that spreads through the tournament scene like wildfire 5: to fling a monkey 6: to split firewood using a sharp instrument 7: To burn
cards.name: Mise
cards.text: Name a nonland card, then reveal the top card of your library. If that card is the named card, draw three cards.

cards.name: Moniker Mage
cards.text:
{U}, Say your middle name: Moniker Mage can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.
{U}, Say an opponent's middle name: Moniker Mage gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Interesting tidbit: Surveys show that the card Ow has one of the most popular pieces of flavor text in the Unglued expansion.
cards.name: Mouth to Mouth
cards.text: You and target opponent have a breath-holding contest. If you win, you gain control of target creature that player controls.

cards.flavor: The quick onyx goblin jumps over the lazy dwarf.
cards.name: Now I Know My ABC's
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control permanents with names that include all twenty-six letters of the English alphabet, you win the game.

cards.flavor: Can you digit?
cards.name: Number Crunch
cards.text:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent says a number, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Number Crunch from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "What the . . . ?"
cards.name: Question Elemental?
cards.text:
Flying
Are you aware that when you say something that isn't a question, the player who first points out this fact gains control of Question Elemental?

cards.flavor: And yea he doth spake: "Let there be Magic."
cards.name: Richard Garfield, Ph.D.
cards.text: You may play cards as though they were other Magic cards of your choice with the same mana cost. (Mana cost includes color.) You can't choose the same card twice.

cards.flavor: "I don't get it. Why doesn't anybody like me?"
cards.name: Smart Ass
cards.text: Whenever Smart Ass attacks, name a card. Defending player may reveal his or her hand and show you that the named card isn't there. If that player doesn't, Smart Ass is unblockable this turn.

cards.flavor: Playing Unhinged, . . .
cards.name: Spell Counter
cards.text:
Counter target spell.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent says "Spell" or "Counter," you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Spell Counter from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "Here on going is heck the what?"
cards.name: Topsy Turvy
cards.text:
The phases of each player's turn are reversed. (The phases are, in reverse order, end, postcombat main, combat, precombat main, and beginning.)
If there are more than two players in the game, the turn order is reversed.

cards.name: Aesthetic Consultation
cards.text: Name an artist. Remove the top six cards of your library from the game, then reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card by the named artist. Put that card in your hand, then remove all the other cards revealed this way from the game.

cards.flavor: He wanders the land in search of Good Ass.
cards.name: Bad Ass
cards.text: {1}{B}, Growl: Regenerate Bad Ass.

cards.flavor:
"That's not an A, it's an Æ. Wait, don't—"
—Hœbrus Væm, Ærathi librarian, last words
cards.name: Bloodletter
cards.text: When the names of three or more nonland permanents begin with the same letter, sacrifice Bloodletter. If you do, it deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor: Real men use Arabian Nights boosters.
cards.name: Booster Tutor
cards.text: Open a sealed Magic booster pack, reveal the cards, and put one of those cards into your hand. (Remove that card from your deck before beginning a new game.)

cards.flavor:
Will players understand that the creature is being crushed by two parentheses?
Not a chance.
cards.name: Duh
cards.text: Destroy target creature with reminder text. (Reminder text is any italicized text in parentheses that explains rules you already know.)

cards.name: Enter the Dungeon
cards.text: Players play a Magic subgame under the table starting at 5 life, using their libraries as their decks. After the subgame ends, the winner searches his or her library for two cards, puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: True, Gargox had blinded himself for life, but the glass eyes never lost.
cards.name: Eye to Eye
cards.text: You and target creature's controller have a staring contest. If you win, destroy that creature.

cards.name: The Fallen Apart
cards.text:
The Fallen Apart comes into play with two arms and two legs.
Whenever damage is dealt to The Fallen Apart, remove an arm or a leg from it.
The Fallen Apart can't attack if it has no legs and can't block if it has no arms.

cards.name: Farewell to Arms
cards.text:
As Farewell to Arms comes into play, choose a hand attached to an opponent's arm.
When the chosen hand isn't behind its owner's back, sacrifice Farewell to Arms. If you do, that player discards his or her hand . . . of cards. (The lawyers wouldn't let us do it the other way.)

cards.imageName: infernal spawn of infernal spawn of evil
cards.name: Infernal Spawn of Infernal Spawn of Evil
cards.text:
Flying, first strike, trample
If you say "I'm coming, too" as you search your library, you may pay {1}{B} and reveal Infernal Spawn of Infernal Spawn of Evil from your library to have it deal 2 damage to a player of your choice. Do this no more than once each turn.

cards.flavor: Getting "Gotcha'ed" again and again.
cards.name: Kill! Destroy!
cards.text:
Destroy target nonblack creature.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent says "Kill" or "Destroy," you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Kill Destroy from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "Word to me."
cards.name: Mother of Goons
cards.text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls is put into a graveyard from play, sacrifice Mother of Goons unless you insult that creature.

cards.name: Necro-Impotence
cards.text:
Skip your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay X life. If you do, untap X permanents.
Pay ½ life: Remove the top card of your library from the game face down. Put that card into your hand at end of turn.

cards.flavor: The torches and pitchforks were no match for Rebecca's fans.
cards.name: Persecute Artist
cards.text: Choose an artist other than Rebecca Guay. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all nonland cards by the chosen artist.

cards.name: Phyrexian Librarian
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove the top card of your library from the game face up and balance it on your body.
When a balanced card falls or touches another balanced card, sacrifice Phyrexian Librarian.

cards.flavor: Now for a squirt of lemon juice.
cards.name: Stop That
cards.text:
Target player discards a card.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent audibly flicks the cards in his or her hand, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Stop That from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "C'mon, choose ‘monkey.' Everybody loves monkeys"
cards.name: Tainted Monkey
cards.text: {T}: Choose a word. Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If that card has the chosen word in its text box, that player loses 3 life.

cards.name: Vile Bile
cards.text: Whenever a player's skin or fingernail touches Vile Bile, that player loses 2 life.

cards.flavor: Ever the warrior, Glissa responded with a "wedgie from beyond Uranus."
cards.name: Wet Willie of the Damned
cards.text: Wet Willie of the Damned deals 2½ damage to target creature or player and you gain 2½ life.

cards.flavor:
"Get it? Bunnies, letters, -X/-X? Me neither."
—Bucky, flavor text writer
cards.name: When Fluffy Bunnies Attack
cards.text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of times the letter of your choice appears in that creature's name.

cards.flavor: Oh, does your nose itch?
cards.name: Working Stiff
cards.text:
As Working Stiff comes into play, straighten your arms.
When you bend an elbow, sacrifice Working Stiff.

cards.flavor: The real advantage of being a zombie gamer? No one notices the stench.
cards.name: Zombie Fanboy
cards.text:
As Zombie Fanboy comes into play, choose an artist.
Whenever a permanent by the chosen artist is put into a graveyard, put two +1/+1 counters on Zombie Fanboy.

cards.flavor: Tired of always being picked last, the wizard Zzzyxas created the ultimate revenge.
cards.name: Zzzyxas's Abyss
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all nonland permanents with the first name alphabetically among nonland permanents in play.

cards.flavor: Who wants to see a picture of a big hairy ass?
cards.name: Assquatch
cards.text:
Each other Donkey gets +1½/+1½.
Whenever another Donkey comes into play, untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Blast from the Past
Curse of the Fire Penguin
cards.text:
Curse of the Fire Penguin consumes and confuses enchanted creature.
-----
Creature Penguin
Trample
When this creature is put into a graveyard from play, return Curse of the Fire Penguin from your graveyard to play.
6/5

cards.flavor: Until he got singed . . .
cards.name: Deal Damage
cards.text:
Deal Damage deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent says "Deal" or "Damage," you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Deal Damage from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Envying the intelligence of goblins is a bad place to be.
cards.name: Dumb Ass
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, target opponent chooses whether Dumb Ass attacks this turn.

cards.flavor: Befuddled by this new game, Argg longed for the days of Rock, Rock, Rock.
cards.name: Face to Face
cards.text: You and target opponent play a best two-out-of-three Rock, Paper, Scissors match. If you win, Face to Face deals 5 damage to that opponent.

cards.flavor: The pen is mightier than the sword.
cards.name: Frazzled Editor
cards.text: Protection from wordy (Something is wordy if it has four or more lines of text in its text box.)

cards.flavor: Pretending to be inside an invisible box was easy enough for Brug. It was finding the invisible door that caused him problems.
cards.name: Goblin Mime
cards.text: When you speak, sacrifice Goblin Mime.

cards.flavor:
SECRET AGENT
PD042198
LICENSE TO BE KILLED
cards.name: Goblin Secret Agent
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal a card from your hand at random.

cards.flavor: They put the "special" in special weapons and tactics.
cards.name: Goblin S.W.A.T. Team
cards.text: Say "Goblin S.W.A.T. Team": Put a +1/+1 counter on Goblin S.W.A.T. Team unless an opponent swats the table within five seconds. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor:
What began as black
Has slowly shifted to red.
Fickle color pie.
cards.name: Mana Flair
cards.text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each nonland permanent by the artist of your choice.

cards.flavor:
Poached Rukh Eggs
Rock
Cooked Rock
Unicorn-on-the-Cob
Wormfang Turtle Soup
cards.name: Mons's Goblin Waiters
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature or land: Add {hr} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
IOU one parashoot
—Urk, mogg fanatic
cards.name: Orcish Paratroopers
cards.text: When Orcish Paratroopers comes into play, flip it from a height of at least one foot. Sacrifice Orcish Paratroopers unless it lands face up after turning over completely.

cards.flavor: "Ooh—right in the colon."
cards.name: Punctuate
cards.text: Punctuate deals damage to target creature equal to half the number of punctuation marks in that creature's text box. (The punctuation marks are  ? , ; : - ( ) / " ' & .)

cards.flavor:
"487. You're welcome."
—Bucky, flavor text writer
cards.name: Pygmy Giant
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Pygmy Giant deals X damage to target creature, where X is a number in the sacrificed creature's text box.

cards.flavor: She was winning the Dominarian "Are You Hot?" competition until disaster struck during the wet T-shirt round.
cards.name: Red-Hot Hottie
cards.text: Whenever Red-Hot Hottie deals damage to a creature, put a third-degree-burn counter on that creature. It has "At the end of each turn, sacrifice this creature unless you scream ‘Aaah' at the top of your lungs."

cards.name: Rocket-Powered Turbo Slug
cards.text: Super haste (This may attack the turn before you play it. (You may put this card into play from your hand, tapped and attacking, during your declare attackers step. If you do, you lose the game at the end of your next turn unless you pay this card's mana cost during that turn.))

cards.flavor:
"Selecting the proper beeble is the key to a good sauté. The pinker the fur and the heartier the yelp, the more succulent the beeble will be when you pop it in your mouth."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar,
The Underworld Cookbook,
cards.name: Sauté
cards.text: Sauté deals 3½ damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Is it six?
cards.name: Six-y Beast
cards.text: As Six-y Beast comes into play, you secretly put six or fewer +1/+1 counters on it, then an opponent guesses the number of counters. If that player guesses right, sacrifice Six-y Beast.

cards.flavor: Judge's ruling: The interior of the face still counts as the face, so a nose-pick is legitimate grounds for saying "Gotcha"
cards.name: Touch and Go
cards.text:
Destroy target land.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent touches his or her face, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Touch and Go from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: It puts the "vortex" in "flavortext."
cards.name: Yet Another Æther Vortex
cards.text:
All creatures have haste.
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
Noninstant, nonsorcery cards on top of a library are in play under their owner's control in addition to being in that library.

cards.flavor: There was a farmer, had a hound . . .
cards.name: B-I-N-G-O
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever a player plays a spell, put a chip counter on its converted mana cost.  
B-I-N-G-O gets +9/+9 for each set of three numbers in a row with chip counters on them.

cards.flavor: There once was a player named Quinn, . . .
cards.name: Creature Guy
cards.text: Gotcha Whenever an opponent says "Creature" or "Guy," you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Creature Guy from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The party was going strong for nearly an hour past midnight—then all of a sudden it just petered out.
cards.name: Elvish House Party
cards.text: Elvish House Party's power and toughness are each equal to the current hour, using the twelve-hour system.

cards.flavor: Our lawyers say no matter how funny it would be, we can't encourage players to eat the cards. Hear that? Whatever you do, don't eat the delicious cards.
cards.name: Fat Ass
cards.text: Fat Ass gets +2/+2 and has trample as long as you're eating. (Food is in your mouth and you're chewing, licking, sucking, or swallowing it.)

cards.name: Form of the Squirrel
cards.text:
As Form of the Squirrel comes into play, put a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token into play. You lose the game when it leaves play.
Creatures can't attack you.
You can't be the target of spells or abilities.
You can't play spells.

cards.flavor: Bitten by radioactive beebles in a freak algebra accident, young Ricky Robertson discovered he'd gained the ability to harness the awesome power of fractions
cards.name: Fraction Jackson
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Return target card with a ½ on it from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Gluetius Maximus
cards.text:
As Gluetius Maximus comes into play, an opponent chooses one of your fingers. (Thumbs are fingers, too.)
When the chosen finger isn't touching Gluetius Maximus, sacrifice Gluetius Maximus.

cards.flavor:
R&D Comments
BB 10/10: Why does a life-gaining card show an old lady killing people?
MR (10/10/03): We'll fix it in the flavor text.
cards.name: Granny's Payback
cards.text: You gain life equal to your age.

cards.flavor: WARNING: THE DOMINARIAN SURGEON GENERAL HAS FOUND THAT SAVAGE BEATINGS CAN LEAD TO CHUMP BLOCKS, LIFE REDUCTION, AND EVEN GAME LOSS.
cards.name: Graphic Violence
cards.text: All creatures by the artist of your choice get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: This is not a subliminal message.
cards.name: Keeper of the Sacred Word
cards.text:
As Keeper of the Sacred Word comes into play, choose a word.
Whenever an opponent says the chosen word, Keeper of the Sacred Word gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Land Aid '04
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card into play tapped, then shuffle your library. If you sang a song the whole time you were searching and shuffling, you may untap that land.

cards.flavor: "Two muffins are baking in an oven. One muffin says to the other muffin, ‘It's getting hot in here, huh?' The other muffin says, ‘Aagh A talking muffin'"
cards.name: Laughing Hyena
cards.text: Gotcha Whenever an opponent laughs, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Laughing Hyena from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Many matches make more madcap monkey mayhem.
cards.name: Monkey Monkey Monkey
cards.text:
As Monkey Monkey Monkey comes into play, choose a letter.
Monkey Monkey Monkey gets +1/+1 for each nonland permanent whose name begins with the chosen letter.

cards.flavor: Gemini (May 21–June 21) This week is a good time to branch out and meet others, but don't forget your roots. Avoid commitments and open flame.
cards.name: Name Dropping
cards.text: Gotcha Whenever an opponent says a word that's in the name of a card in your graveyard, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return that card to your hand.

cards.flavor: "These kids today with their collector numbers and their newfangled tap symbol. Twenty Black Lotuses and twenty Plague Rats. Now that's real Magic."
cards.name: Old Fogey
cards.text: Phasing, cumulative upkeep {1}, echo, fading 3, bands with other Dinosaurs, protection from Homarids, snow-covered plainswalk, flanking, rampage 2

cards.flavor: Just call it OMRSTPLRLCNSWMTCTHTALCNEE for short.
cards.imageName: our market research shows that players like really long card names so we made
cards.name: Our Market Research Shows That Players Like Really Long Card Names So We Made this Card to Have the Absolute Longest Card Name Ever Elemental
cards.text: Art rampage 2 (Whenever this becomes blocked by a creature, it gets +2/+2 for each creature in the blocker's art beyond the first.)

cards.flavor:
6 PM (23) This Old Grove 98055
A rusted masticore makes a beautiful addition to any garden.
cards.name: Remodel
cards.text:
If you control two or more green permanents that share an artist, you may play Remodel without paying its mana cost.
Remove target artifact from the game.

cards.flavor: It grows several feet a year.
cards.name: Shoe Tree
cards.text:
Shoe Tree comes into play with up to two shoe counters on it. Use your shoes as counters.
Shoe Tree gets +1/+1 for each shoe counter on it.

cards.flavor: His friends at the gym never knew Garanth's secret shame. For years he had tried to walk away from professional arm wrestling, but hey—free monkeys.
cards.name: Side to Side
cards.text: You and target opponent arm-wrestle. If you win, put a 3/3 green Ape creature token into play.

cards.name: S.N.O.T.
cards.text:
As S.N.O.T. comes into play, you may stick it onto another creature named S.N.O.T. in play. If you do, all those creatures form a single creature.
S.N.O.T.'s power and toughness are equal to the square of the number of S.N.O.T.s stuck together. (One is a 1/1, two are a 4/4, three are a 9/9, and four are a 16/16.)

cards.name: Stone-Cold Basilisk
cards.text:
Whenever Stone-Cold Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a creature with fewer letters in its name, destroy that creature at end of combat. (Punctuation and spaces aren't letters.)
Whenever an opponent reads Stone-Cold Basilisk, that player is turned to stone until end of turn. Stoned players can't attack, block, or play spells or abilities.

cards.flavor: You want "mise" with that?
cards.name: Supersize
cards.text: Target creature gets +3½/+3½ until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Everyone break into teams. Weaponry, you're with me. Nature group, meet by the palm tree. Stoneworks and metalworks, follow the anvil. Everyone else, gather around the giant V."
—Sword of Kaldra
cards.name: Symbol Status
cards.text: Put a 1/1 colorless Expansion-Symbol creature token into play for each different expansion symbol among permanents you control.

cards.flavor: "I desire the acquisition of a potassium-rich fruit comestible of substantial magnitude."
cards.name: Uktabi Kong
cards.text:
Trample
When Uktabi Kong comes into play, destroy all artifacts.
Tap two untapped Apes you control: Put a 1/1 green Ape creature token into play.

cards.name: "Ach! Hans, Run!"
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may say "Ach! Hans, run! It's the . . ." and name a creature card. If you do, search your library for the named card, put it into play, then shuffle your library. That creature has haste. Remove it from the game at end of turn.

cards.flavor:
Asses to ashes,
Donkeys to dust.
cards.name: Ass Whuppin'
cards.text: Destroy target silver-bordered permanent in any game you can see from your seat.

cards.flavor: These kids know their four-letter words.
cards.name: Meddling Kids
cards.text:
As Meddling Kids comes into play, choose a word with four or more letters.
Nonland cards with the chosen word in their text box can't be played.

cards.flavor: The only rare you'll ever need. Okay, not really.
cards.name: Rare-B-Gone
cards.text: Each player sacrifices all rare permanents, then reveals his or her hand and discards all rare cards.

cards.name: Who
cards.text: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: What
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: When
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Where
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Why
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor: Help us . . . R&D under mental domination of alien brain in jar . . . only chance . . . Gleemax's blatant disregard for flavor text . . . send help
cards.name: Gleemax
cards.text: You choose all targets for all spells and abilities.

cards.flavor: "Dear Magic R&D, . . ."
cards.name: Letter Bomb
cards.text: When Letter Bomb comes into play, sign it and shuffle it into target player's library. That player reveals each card he or she draws until Letter Bomb is drawn. When that player draws Letter Bomb, it deals 19½ damage to him or her.

cards.flavor: There was no darker or more evil creation in all the multiverse than that of the mana screw.
cards.name: Mana Screw
cards.text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, add {2} to your mana pool. Play this ability only any time you could play an instant.

cards.name: Mox Lotus
cards.text:
{T}: Add {∞} to your mana pool.
{100}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
You don't lose life due to mana burn.

cards.flavor: This card is named My First Tome.
cards.name: My First Tome
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Say the flavor text on a card in your hand. Target opponent guesses that card's name. You may reveal that card. If you do and your opponent guessed wrong, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"I would have made a ‘Spin-The-Bottle' joke if I thought anyone reading this had ever played the game."
—Bucky, flavor text writer
cards.name: Pointy Finger of Doom
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Spin Pointy Finger of Doom in the middle of the table so that it rotates completely at least once, then destroy the closest permanent the finger points to.

cards.flavor: Minutes before the campus watch busted pledge week at the Alpha Beta Unlimited house . . .
cards.name: Rod of Spanking
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Rod of Spanking deals 1 damage to target player. Then untap Rod of Spanking unless that player says "Thank you, sir. May I have another?"

cards.name: Time Machine
cards.text: {T}: Remove Time Machine and target nontoken creature you own from the game. Return both cards to play at the beginning of your upkeep on your turn X of the next game you play with the same opponent, where X is the removed creature's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Togglodyte
cards.text:
Togglodyte comes into play turned on.
Whenever a player plays a spell, toggle Togglodyte's ON/OFF switch.
As long as Togglodyte is turned off, it can't attack or block, and all damage it would deal is prevented.

cards.name: Toy Boat
cards.text: Cumulative upkeep—Say "Toy Boat" quickly. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on Toy Boat, then sacrifice it unless you say "Toy Boat" once for each age counter on it—without pausing between or fumbling it.)

cards.flavor: www.wizards.com/hottub
cards.name: Urza's Hot Tub
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card: Search your library for a card that shares a complete word in its name with the discarded card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Water Gun Balloon Game
cards.text:
As Water Gun Balloon Game comes into play, each player puts a pop counter on a 0.
Whenever a player plays a spell, move that player's pop counter up 1.
Whenever a player's pop counter hits 5, that player puts a 5/5 pink Giant Teddy Bear creature token into play and resets all pop counters to 0.

cards.flavor: YOUR AD HERE
cards.name: World-Bottling Kit
cards.text: {5}, Sacrifice World-Bottling Kit: Choose a Magic set. Remove from the game all permanents with that set's expansion symbol except for basic lands.

cards.name: City of Ass
cards.text:
City of Ass comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one and one-half mana of any one color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Let them complain. As long as the addictive ink is working, we can do anything we want."
PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK
cards.name: R&D's Secret Lair
cards.text:
Play cards as written. Ignore all errata.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "Ooh . . . shiny"
cards.name: Super Secret Tech
cards.text:
All premium spells cost {1} less to play.
All premium creatures get +1/+1.
